results.title: The Amazon: life along the river in Peru
results.brief_description: Following the Amazon River to its sources in the High Andes of Peru, this film surveys the geography of the Maranon river area and the peoples way of life and variation in climate and vegetation on the western and eastern slopes and in the foothills of the Andes. Also shown is the city of Iquitos - the trade centre of the Upper Andes and its environs, the abundantly productive rainforests No other credits available.

results.title: The Amazon awakens
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Inter-American Affairs
results.brief_description: The story of the Amazon River Basin; its history and exploration by early Spanish explorers; its industrial progress; the natural resources and vast riches of this region still awaiting discovery and exploitation.

results.title: The Amazing newborn
results.creator_credit: Maureen Hack and Patricia E Rambasek
results.brief_description: Shows how normal infants aged 1-7 days can see and have visual preferences, turn their heads in response to spoken words, mimic and move in rhythm to parental voices. It also shows the six states of consciousness first observed by Peter Wolff.

results.title: The Amazing magnet
results.creator_credit: Video Arts, Michael Latham and Christopher Haws
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Start Here: Adventures into Science”.
This program presents a range of experiments that demonstrate the forces of magnets. Illustrates the nature and properties of magnetic fields, briefly traces the history of the compass, shows how the earth behaves like a magnet and presents some modern applications of electro- magnets.

results.title: The Amazing laser
results.creator_credit: London Television Service, Richard Reisz and Eddie Newstead
results.brief_description: The laser has applications in many fields, from entertainment to scientific research. Looks at some of the ways in which lasers are being used, and possible future development with lasers. It is being used in the printing industry for etching copper plates, in the search for cheap energy by producing fusion reactions in the laboratory, as a scalpel in surgery, and for making holograms. Narrated by Paul Vaughan.

results.title: The Amazing Bone (K)
results.creator_credit: Weston Woods Studios, Michael Sporn Animation and Michael Sporn
results.brief_description: Pearl the pig finds a magic talking bone. On the way home the bone scares off a band of muggers, but does not fair as well with a debonair fox. Although Pearl and the talking bone so live happily ever after.

results.title: The Amazing bone
results.brief_description: Pearl, a lively young pig, touched by spring, happens upon a talking bone that belonged to a witch. The bone scares off a band of muggers, but does not fare as well with the debonair fox. From a book by William Steig.

results.title: The Amazing adventures of Mr. Bean
results.brief_description: Two episodes of the popular television series starring Rowan Atkinson. In the first episode “Mr. Bean” he experiences every students worst nightmare - sitting for an exam in which you don’t know any of the answers. He then experiences every beachgoers’ nightmare - being on a beach with other people and nowhere to change. Finally he experiences every churchgoers nightmare - a general lack of concentration. His solutions to these problems must be seen to be believed. “The return of Mr. Bean” sees him shopping with his American Express Card. Together, these episodes provide the ideal instruction manual for would-be idiots everywhere. Includes material not previously seen on television.

results.title: The Amazing adventures of Morph
results.brief_description: Morph, the favourite children’s TV character is back on your screen! The little clay man from Tony Hart’s art studio appears on video with thirteen of his best adventures ever. Join in the fun with Morph, the troublesome Chas, the geriatric skateboarder Grand Morph, the two girls Folly and Delilah, the gentle giant Gillespie, Nailbrush - who thinks he’s a dog, and the helpful tribe of ‘very small creatures’. The legend of Morph lives on, in over 55 minutes of fun. Narrated by Tony Hart.
